edu.ucsd.ccdb.ontomorph2.core.tangible
Class CurveAnchorPoint

java.lang.Object
  java.util.Observable
      edu.ucsd.ccdb.ontomorph2.core.tangible.Tangible
          edu.ucsd.ccdb.ontomorph2.core.tangible.CurveAnchorPoint
All Implemented Interfaces:
ISemanticsAware, ISelectable
public class CurveAnchorPoint
extends Tangible

Represents a single point in a Bezier curve. When it gets repositioned, it updates that point in its parent BezierCurve automatically.

Author:
Stephen D. Larson (slarson@ncmir.ucsd.edu)

public Curve3D getParentCurve()
Meant to be used to access the functionality of the curve this anchor point belongs to Should not be used for creating new curves, but ok for creating new anchor points

aproxTime

public float aproxTime()
Approximate 'time' of this point along the parentCurve NOT RELIABLE - this is only an estimate

Returns:
(0-1) the time, as a float between 0 and 1 that represents the position along the curve.

Null implementation overriding super class functionality to prevent rotation

Overrides:
rotate in class Tangible
constraint - the axis (or axes) on which to rotate the object. For example, if constraint is (1,0,0) the object will rotates about it's own X axis (not the world's X axis)
